alert.note: Alert for Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountain Valley Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 2:51PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Fremont and north central Custer Counties through 315 PM MDT... At 251 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southeast of Texas Creek, or 18 miles east of Hayden Pass Burn Scar, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Fremont and north central Custer Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountain Valley Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft
